title: Govt Has No Interest To Sabotage Nana Addo - Kwakye Ofosu
text:
Politics | 14 October 2015 13:47 CET ‘Gov’t Has No Interest To Sabotage Nana Addo’ - Kwakye Ofosu Source: Starrfmonline.com 
Deputy Communications minister Kwakye Ofosu 
Government has stated that it has no interest in sabotaging the flagbearer of the opposition New Patriotic Party Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo from articulating his vision and plans to Ghanaians. 
A report by the New Crusading Guide Newspaper on Wednesday stated that a planned interview by Nana Addo on Citi FM Monday suffered a major setback in the middle of the interview when the network was jammed but was mysteriously restored 10 minutes after the interview was over. 
According to the report, the Accra-based radio station’s satellite and online streams were jammed during the course of the interview. The paper claims that government is behind the efforts to sabotage the opposition leader. 
But a deputy communications Minister, Felix Kwakye-Ofosu has dismissed the claim describing it as astonishing and a deliberate misinformation. 
Speaking on Morning Starr Wednesday, Mr. Kwakye Ofosu told host Nii Arday Clegg that the allegations must be ignored by well-meaning Ghanaians. 
"There is no, absolutely no policy on the part of government to prevent him from being heard, it is impractical...it is not the first interview that Nana Addo has granted and I think that the management of Citi FM must distance themself from this deliberate campaign of misinformation," Kwakye-Ofosu said. 
He added: “At no point in time has it been the policy of government, effected through any agency under it, to block access to an interview being done by an opposition leader. 
“In any event, the interview that he [New Crusading Guide’s Editor] is talking about was widely monitored and there was commentary run on it by various media platforms,” he stressed. Politics Follow Us He who has an engel as a friend doesnt have to be afraid of anything in this world By: akoaso-HH
